intro: Lampocarya rawacensis, commonly known as the Rawac sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Lampocarya rawacensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
